intro: Psychotria rutshuruensis, commonly known as the Congo arrow poison, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant contains various alkaloids, some of which have been studied for their potential medicinal properties. It is often found in moist, shaded areas and thrives in the understory of dense tropical forests. Due to its toxic properties, it is handled with caution in both traditional and modern contexts.
